title: 113_hr5789
content: The "Rapid DNA Act of 2014" is cited as the short title of the Act. The DNA Identification Act of 1994 is amended to include new definitions. The "Rapid DNA Act of 2014" introduces new definitions related to DNA analysis, including terms like reference DNA sample, DNA analysis, sample-to-answer DNA analysis systems, qualified agencies, and operators. The "Rapid DNA Act of 2014" defines operators as individuals trained to operate a sample-to-answer DNA system. SEC. 3. REVISED QUALITY ASSURANCE AND PROFICIENCY TESTING STANDARDS. Section 210303 of the DNA Identification Act of 1994 is amended to include members from Federal, State, and local law enforcement agencies in DNA testing proficiency standards for sample-to-answer DNA analysis systems. The DNA Identification Act of 1994 is amended to include qualified agencies in DNA testing proficiency standards for sample-to-answer DNA analysis systems. The DNA Identification Act of 1994 is amended to include qualified agencies in DNA testing proficiency standards for sample-to-answer DNA analysis systems. This includes provisions for conducting DNA analyses and blind external proficiency tests for such agencies. The DNA Identification Act of 1994 is amended to include qualifying agencies in DNA testing standards for sample-to-answer systems, specifically for agencies involved in intake, processing, booking, detention, or incarceration of individuals charged with qualifying offenses. SEC. 5 of the DNA Identification Act of 1994 is amended to require DNA analysis on a sample-to-answer system.
